Description: Rim and body sherd of South Ionian pottery cup with everted rim; interior: rim glazed; top of wall reserved with single dilute line; glazed below; exterior: lip and handle zone reserved with band between; glazed below; inscription on exterior.
Type series: Vallet and Villard Ionian Cup Type B2
Curator's comments: Schlotzhauer Identifies the sherd as belonging to a Type 9A South Ionian cup with everted rim. Type 9 cups have been found in large numbers in other sanctuary settings including at the Sanctuary of Demeter and Kore at Tocra, and at the site of Megara Hyblaea on Sicily. This type was the most common type of South Ionian cups with everted rims found at Naukratis. The Type 9 shape evolved from the earlier Type 5 cup shape. There is a modern inscription (DIOSK) on the exterior surface of the rim signifying the location of the find.
Bibliographic references: Gardner 1888 / Naukratis II (p. 67, no. 843, pl. XXII, no. 843)
Bernand 1970 / Le Delta égyptien d'après les textes grecs, i: les confins libyques (p. 691, no. 492)
Schlotzhauer 2012 / Untersuchungen zur archaischen griechischen Keramik aus Naukratis (p. 52, no. 244, NAU 57, pl.12h)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GE.618) (Phase 3)
